item.title: By: Roni Zeiger
item.dc:creator: Roni Zeiger
item.description: Franny, thank you for sharing a bit about your story. We will include Bonnie's comments about hospice care and preparing to die in the final video of her. The clip about tango is a preview of what this special one has shared.
item.content:encoded: Franny, thank you for sharing a bit about your story. We will include Bonnie’s comments about hospice care and preparing to die in the final video of her. The clip about tango is a preview of what this special one has shared.

item.title: By: Franny
item.dc:creator: Franny
item.description: Ovarian cancer remains SO difficult to diagnosis . As a ten year survivor I still have nightmares about my hospital stories associated with diagnosis. But all stories are different . Now a five year breast cancer survivor as well- yes facing the second diagnosis was another story. I love the tango story but was sad she didn't "talk" about her experience of hospice care & preparing to die.
item.content:encoded: Ovarian cancer remains SO difficult to diagnosis . As a ten year survivor I still have nightmares about my hospital stories associated with diagnosis. But all stories are different . Now a five year breast cancer survivor as well- yes facing the second diagnosis was another story. I love the tango story but was sad she didn’t “talk” about her experience of hospice care & preparing to die.

item.title: By: Roni Zeiger
item.dc:creator: Roni Zeiger
item.description: hi Mike, I'm so sorry for your loss. We certainly didn't mean to suggest that everyone has the same story. Just the opposite: each story is unique and important and can teach us a huge amount. Our hope is to help people who want to share their stories to do so, so that more of us can learn from them.
item.content:encoded: hi Mike, I’m so sorry for your loss. We certainly didn’t mean to suggest that everyone has the same story. Just the opposite: each story is unique and important and can teach us a huge amount. Our hope is to help people who want to share their stories to do so, so that more of us can learn from them.

item.title: By: Chris
item.dc:creator: Chris
item.description: Lucie, all of us are different. None of us are perfect. Not all cancer patients have to endure radiation or chemo, but that does not make their stories any less relevant.
item.content:encoded: Lucie, all of us are different. None of us are perfect. Not all cancer patients have to endure radiation or chemo, but that does not make their stories any less relevant.

item.title: By: mike zwally
item.dc:creator: mike zwally
item.description: two years ago i lost my mom at the age of 60 to ov cancer..mom thought she just had a tummy ache and put on a few pounds..sadly it was stage 4 and had ahold strong..took over two years for her to loose her fight..to the one who posted it was so a typical...well no cancer is just cancer..dont care cancer is scary ...had there been more known about ov cancer and my mom knew of it she might still be here...so to say its just the same ole story of someone with cancer is very rude on your part....i can only hope u never ever have to see someone u love slowly die because of cancer
item.content:encoded: two years ago i lost my mom at the age of 60 to ov cancer..mom thought she just had a tummy ache and put on a few pounds..sadly it was stage 4 and had ahold strong..took over two years for her to loose her fight..to the one who posted it was so a typical…well no cancer is just cancer..dont care cancer is scary …had there been more known about ov cancer and my mom knew of it she might still be here…so to say its just the same ole story of someone with cancer is very rude on your part….i can only hope u never ever have to see someone u love slowly die because of cancer

item.title: By: Roni Zeiger
item.dc:creator: Roni Zeiger
item.description: hi Lucie, that's a fair perspective. Others had shared with us that they found it helpful and could identify with his struggle. In any case, we look forward to sharing Bonnie's story with you soon.
item.content:encoded: hi Lucie, that’s a fair perspective. Others had shared with us that they found it helpful and could identify with his struggle. In any case, we look forward to sharing Bonnie’s story with you soon.

item.title: By: Lucie Johnson
item.dc:creator: Lucie Johnson
item.description: While the story you have here above (of the woman with ovarian cancer and the red tango shoes) promises to be interesting and promising, the sample story you have on indiegogo is rather awful as a sample story. Sure, it's legitimate, it's someone story, but it is so atypical... It's more about someone who has not adjusted to the shock of what he went through, even though he is OK now...
item.content:encoded: While the story you have here above (of the woman with ovarian cancer and the red tango shoes) promises to be interesting and promising, the sample story you have on indiegogo is rather awful as a sample story. Sure, it’s legitimate, it’s someone story, but it is so atypical… It’s more about someone who has not adjusted to the shock of what he went through, even though he is OK now…
